description:

**Location:** Thousand Oaks, Santa Clarita and Surrounding Areas  
**Employment Type:** Full\\-Time, Non\\-Exempt (Hourly)  
**Pay Range:** $23\\.00 – $48\\.00 per hour (DOE) \\+ Weekly Bonus Incentive  
**Reports To:** Field Supervisor and/or Area Manager

**About UPE Resources**

UPE Resources, Inc. is a mission\\-driven company providing professional **Utility Vegetation Management (UVM)**, arboriculture, and environmental consulting services nationwide. Founded in 2006, UPE has grown into a trusted leader in **vegetation inspection, wildfire mitigation, and utility asset protection** across California and beyond.

Our success is built on **field excellence, safety, and technical precision**. Every day, our inspectors and arborists work across diverse environments — from coastal communities to mountain corridors — delivering high\\-quality vegetation assessments that protect both people and infrastructure.

We combine the professionalism of a large firm with the agility and culture of a close\\-knit team. As we continue to expand nationally, we remain committed to **developing our people, advancing industry standards, and creating lasting career opportunities** for those passionate about trees, safety, and the environment.

**Overview**

UPE Resources is hiring motivated professionals to join our field inspection teams as **Consulting Utility Foresters (CUFs)** and **ISA Certified Arborists**. These are hands\\-on, field\\-based roles responsible for assessing vegetation near utility infrastructure, supporting wildfire mitigation, and ensuring regulatory compliance.

This is an opportunity to build a **meaningful outdoor career** while contributing to public safety and environmental protection. Our employees work independently in the field, applying technical knowledge, sound judgment, and communication skills to deliver accurate, data\\-driven inspections.

UPE offers a **structured career path** from entry\\-level trainees to certified arborists, supported by paid training, credential reimbursement, and mentorship from experienced professionals. Whether you’re new to the industry or an ISA\\-certified arborist seeking advancement, this role provides the opportunity to grow within a company that values **technical excellence, field leadership, and professional development**.

**Career Pathways \\& Pay Structure**

UPE Resources offers a clear and achievable career progression for professionals in utility vegetation management. Each level reflects growing technical expertise, arboricultural knowledge, and leadership responsibility — supported by hands\\-on training, mentorship, and credential development. Employees are encouraged to advance through education, certification, and demonstrated field performance.

**Entry Level – CUF Trainee / CUF I ($23 – $27\\.50/hr)**These positions are ideal for both new and developing professionals eager to begin or advance a career in arboriculture and vegetation management. Employees learn the fundamentals of vegetation inspection, safety protocols, species identification, and the use of GPS/GIS\\-based mapping technology.  
Trainees and CUF I foresters work under the guidance of experienced mentors, gaining real\\-world experience in field operations, data collection, and vegetation clearance standards. This level builds the essential technical, observational, and communication skills required to progress toward fully independent inspection work.

**Intermediate Level – CUF II / CUF III ($28 – $36/hr)**At this stage, team members operate independently in the field with strong knowledge of vegetation clearance requirements, inspection accuracy, and client communication. CUF II and III professionals demonstrate confidence in tree identification, hazard recognition, and environmental awareness while applying regional vegetation standards and utility\\-specific protocols.  
These inspectors play an essential role in maintaining quality and consistency across projects. They are trusted to make field decisions, support quality control efforts, and collaborate directly with utility partners or vegetation crews. Strong technical proficiency with GIS/mobile software and consistent documentation are critical at this level. Continued training, testing, and mentorship prepare employees for certification and higher technical roles.

**Certified Level – Arborist I / II / III ($40 – $48/hr)**ISA Certified Arborists represent the highest tier of technical expertise within UPE’s field operations. Arborists apply advanced arboricultural science and professional standards to vegetation inspection, risk assessment, and compliance management. Their work involves interpreting complex vegetation conditions, diagnosing tree health, and applying ISA and ANSI A300 standards to inform vegetation management recommendations.  
Arborists also play a key role in **mentoring field inspectors, supporting training initiatives, and driving quality improvement** across projects. As seasoned professionals, they often collaborate with utility clients on sensitive or high\\-priority sites, contribute to vegetation planning and audits, and serve as technical advisors to management.  
This level serves as the **primary development pathway toward future leadership roles**, including field supervision and operational management. Arborists who demonstrate strong communication, mentorship, and organizational skills are positioned to advance into UPE’s leadership track — guiding teams, shaping field programs, and supporting the next generation of professionals in the industry.

**Key Responsibilities**

As part of UPE Resources’ field operations team, employees play a critical role in maintaining public safety, ensuring utility reliability, and upholding environmental responsibility. Each position combines technical fieldwork, professional judgment, and a commitment to quality.  
Responsibilities grow with experience and certification — from mastering foundational inspection techniques to providing expert\\-level consultation and mentorship in the field.

**All Field Levels**

* Conduct vegetation inspections along utility corridors, rights\\-of\\-way, and access routes to identify trees and vegetation that may interfere with utility infrastructure.
* Apply safety protocols, environmental awareness, and sound judgment while performing fieldwork in diverse outdoor conditions.
* Accurately identify tree species, growth characteristics, and potential hazards such as structural defects, decay, or pest and disease symptoms.
* Utilize GPS/GIS\\-enabled mobile tools to collect field data, map vegetation, and document inspection results with precision and timeliness.
* Communicate professionally with property owners, vegetation crews, and utility representatives to ensure effective and respectful field interactions.
* Maintain a strong focus on safety, quality, and adherence to company and industry standards (OSHA, ANSI Z133, ANSI A300\\).
* Participate in ongoing safety meetings, training sessions, and mentorship opportunities to continuously improve technical and professional skills.

**CUF Trainee / CUF I**

* Learn and apply fundamental vegetation inspection practices under the supervision of experienced foresters and arborists.
* Develop foundational knowledge of tree identification, vegetation clearance requirements, and regional environmental factors.
* Support senior staff in field inspections, data entry, and the review of vegetation management standards.
* Demonstrate consistent improvement in observation, documentation, and adherence to established field safety and quality protocols.
* Participate in structured training, technical onboarding, and job shadowing to prepare for independent field inspection work.

**CUF II / CUF III**

* Perform independent vegetation inspections along transmission and distribution corridors, ensuring compliance with all utility clearance specifications.
* Identify hazard trees, vegetation encroachments, and environmental sensitivities that require mitigation or monitoring.
* Coordinate directly with vegetation management crews and utility contacts to resolve field issues and support project execution.
* Apply intermediate to advanced knowledge of tree species, growth patterns, pests, and diseases relevant to regional conditions.
* Ensure data accuracy and consistency through detailed field reporting and GIS documentation.
* Support quality control reviews, internal audits, and storm or emergency response efforts as needed.
* Serve as a peer mentor for less experienced staff, modeling professionalism, accountability, and field efficiency.

**Arborist I – Certified Technical Specialist**

* Perform detailed tree and vegetation assessments using ISA and ANSI A300 standards to identify risk, decay, and species\\-specific structural concerns.
* Apply ISA best practices to document and recommend appropriate pruning, removal, or mitigation strategies.
* Support vegetation management planning through precise field data collection and technical reporting.
* Act as a technical resource for CUF staff, providing informal guidance on species ID, inspection methodology, and professional standards.
* Maintain ISA certification and engage in continuing education to ensure up\\-to\\-date knowledge of arboricultural science and industry practices.

**Arborist II – Advanced Specialist / Regional Consultant**

* Conduct advanced tree risk assessments using **TRAQ protocols**, integrating biological, mechanical, and environmental factors to evaluate potential hazards.
* Collaborate with utility clients on vegetation risk mitigation strategies, permitting requirements, and compliance documentation.
* Provide structured mentorship and technical support to CUFs and Arborist I staff, reinforcing inspection consistency and field accuracy.
* Participate in complex or specialized projects such as pre\\-storm analysis, regulatory compliance audits, and vegetation strategy development.
* Demonstrate strong communication and leadership skills when representing UPE in client meetings, trainings, or technical advisory discussions.

**Arborist III – Senior Technical Advisor / Subject Matter Expert**

* Serve as a high\\-level technical authority on vegetation management, tree risk modeling, and arboricultural science.
* Lead vegetation audits, policy reviews, and advanced field consultations on complex or high\\-priority utility corridors.
* Provide expert recommendations and written documentation for vegetation\\-related risk mitigation, client reporting, and program compliance.
* Mentor and coach Arborist I/II and CUF staff, promoting continuous professional growth and alignment with ISA and ANSI standards.
* Support storm response operations, post\\-event assessments, and large\\-scale vegetation evaluation programs.
* Collaborate with management to refine internal standards, develop training materials, and contribute to companywide best practice initiatives.
* Represent UPE as a technical ambassador within the utility vegetation and arboriculture community, reinforcing the company’s reputation for excellence and professionalism.

**Qualifications**

UPE Resources is committed to maintaining the highest professional standards in the utility vegetation management industry — but we also believe that talent can be developed through training, mentorship, and hands\\-on experience. Our goal is to build long\\-term careers, not just fill positions.

We value individuals who bring curiosity, accountability, and a willingness to learn. Whether you’re entering the industry for the first time or expanding your professional credentials, UPE provides the structure and support needed to grow. Our training programs, field mentorship, and company\\-sponsored certifications allow motivated employees to advance through defined career tiers — gaining the technical, operational, and leadership skills that define UPE’s reputation for excellence.

The following qualifications outline what we look for across all levels — from foundational field roles to advanced, certified arboricultural specialists.

**Minimum Requirements (All Levels)**

* Valid driver’s license with an insurable driving record.
* Comfortable working outdoors in varying weather and terrain conditions.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Basic computer proficiency, including the use of mobile devices and data collection tools.
* Ability to work independently and manage time efficiently while maintaining accuracy and accountability.
* Commitment to safety, professionalism, and adherence to company and industry standards.

**CUF Trainee / CUF I**

* High school diploma or equivalent; coursework or degree in forestry, environmental studies, horticulture, or related fields preferred.
* Interest in trees, ecology, or environmental work with a desire to build a long\\-term career in utility vegetation management.
* Ability to learn field inspection procedures, identify tree species, and apply vegetation clearance standards under supervision.
* Demonstrated reliability, attention to detail, and willingness to participate in on\\-the\\-job training and mentorship programs.

**CUF II / CUF III**

* One or more years of experience in utility vegetation management, forestry, arboriculture, or environmental fieldwork.
* Working knowledge of vegetation clearance standards, basic pruning principles, and hazard recognition.
* Ability to identify regional tree species, pests, and diseases affecting vegetation health.
* Proficiency in GPS/GIS\\-based data collection tools and digital mapping systems.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills for field documentation and stakeholder interaction.
* Demonstrated ability to perform independent field inspections, meet production goals, and maintain quality and consistency in work.
* ISA Certified Arborist or TRAQ credential preferred but not required; company\\-sponsored certification programs available.

**Arborist I – Certified Technical Specialist**

* ISA Certified Arborist credential (required).
* Three or more years of experience in arboriculture, utility vegetation management, or related natural resource fields.
* Advanced knowledge of tree biology, risk indicators, and ANSI A300 standards for pruning and maintenance.
* Strong technical writing and documentation skills with attention to regulatory compliance.
* Ability to mentor CUF\\-level staff in field techniques, inspection methods, and safety standards.
* Demonstrated commitment to professional development through continuing education and credential maintenance.

**Arborist II – Advanced Specialist / Regional Consultant**

* ISA Certified Arborist and TRAQ credentials (required).
* Five or more years of experience in utility vegetation management or professional arboriculture.
* Advanced proficiency in tree risk assessment, vegetation planning, and regulatory compliance.
* Strong leadership and mentoring ability with experience training or supporting field teams.
* Familiarity with permitting processes, sensitive site management, and utility client coordination.
* Excellent communication and analytical skills for complex vegetation evaluations and reporting.

**Arborist III – Senior Technical Advisor / Subject Matter Expert**

* ISA Certified Arborist, TRAQ, and Utility Specialist certifications (required).
* Seven or more years of progressive experience in utility vegetation management or advanced arboriculture.
* Recognized expertise in vegetation risk modeling, audit processes, and long\\-term vegetation program development.
* Proven ability to lead training programs, support field audits, and provide technical guidance to management and utility partners.
* Strong technical writing and presentation skills with the ability to represent UPE in professional and client\\-facing settings.
* Demonstrated interest in advancing industry best practices, contributing to internal process improvement, and mentoring future leaders.

**Compensation \\& Benefits**

UPE Resources offers a competitive compensation and benefits package designed to support long\\-term employee success and professional growth.

* Competitive hourly pay \\+ Weekly Bonus Incentive
* Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance (eligible after 90 days)
* 401(k) with Company Match
* Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays
* Company\\-Provided Vehicle, Fuel Card, and Cell Phone (for qualifying positions)
* Paid Arboriculture Training \\& Credential Reimbursement
* Advancement opportunities across multiple technical tiers
* Supportive, safety\\-first field culture with career mentorship

**Work Schedule \\& Travel**

* Full\\-time, Monday through Friday (8\\-hour shifts; overtime as needed)
* Field\\-based position with daily travel throughout assigned region
* Occasional weekend or storm response work may be required
* Overnight travel may occasionally be required for regional or statewide assignments
